content: With some personal history of coming across soundness issues rather frequently in the recent past, I‚Äôm regularly relying on team members to apply the I-unsound üí• label for me. Is there any reason, in principle, why there is (AFAICT) no way to assign the label with rustbot? Especially considering the fact that regression labels can also be set by anyone now, why not unsound labels? And I‚Äôd be happy if anyone can set the label manually for #85813 in the meantime :smile:

I think one reason can be it is undesirable for everyone to be able to trigger a zulip message using a simple comment. How about allow users who have contributed at least once to set that label.

Maybe the needs-fcp label could also be permitted to be set by anyone (or a contributor)? Because I came across #85835 and wanted to add the label.
What do you mean by ‚Äútrigger a zulip message‚Äù? The prioritization? That applies to regressions labels as-well which ‚Äì as I mentioned ‚Äì can be set using rustbot.
I think the I-prioritization label is meant to be usable by anyone though, there is even a special @rustbot prioritize command for it

Also, shouldn't it be allowed? In the triagebot.toml, there is:

    # I-* without I-nominated
    "I-*", "!I-nominated",

Shouldn't I-unsound üí• match I-*?

L√©o Lanteri Thauvin said:

Also, shouldn't it be allowed?

Hm‚Ä¶ this is something I kind-of already suspected. Thus the AFAICT in my own statement:

there is (AFAICT) no way to assign the label with rustbot

The reason then might be that, AFAICT, there‚Äôs no way to give rustbot a label that contains spaces :wink:

I have looked into the documentation and I think even parts of the source code for rustbot and there might in fact be no way to pass a label with spaces. I‚Äôm not too motivated to play around with it all that much either anyway, because rustbot error message are terrible spam. They never go away and quickly start cluttering your issue threads.
Oh, well that's much more easily fixable, you should have started with that :P
it's accurate that there's no way to pass spaces in
IMO the "better" fix there is just to cut spaces from the label name
we really don't need an exploding emoji either

IMO the "better" fix there is just to cut spaces from the label name

Doing that now
Done, @Frank Steffahn you should be able to add the label on your own now

One relevant part of the triagebot.toml linked above

[autolabel."I-prioritize"]
trigger_labels = [
    "regression-untriaged",
    "regression-from-stable-to-stable",
    "regression-from-stable-to-beta",
    "regression-from-stable-to-nightly",
    "I-unsound üí•",
]

might need updating, too?
@Frank Steffahn can you make a PR for that? I don't have time now, sorry
